history.content: I have not personally used Data 8 + CS 88 to replace CS 61A, but CS 61B teaches very different material from 61A (and you learn a different programming language), so how well you do in 61A does not necessarily affect how well you'll do in 61B. CS 88 is essentially a shortened version 61A (if you take a look at the course website, a lot of topics/hw/projects are taken from 61A), while Data 8 teaches basic Python with an emphasis on statistics/data science, so they are likely sufficient as an introduction to CS. You can always look at the course website for 61A and self-study topics that are not covered in C88!

Hi I want to major in Data Science. I am currently taking data 8. The major said they accept Data 8 and CS88 in place of 61A, however, I will have to take 61B. So I am wondering if I will be better prepared taking 61A for 61B or if data 8 + CAS 88 will suffice and provide me with the same foundation going into 61B. Basically, will I be able to do well and not feel behind if I don't take 61A before 61B?
history.subject: do data 8 & CS88 give the same foundation for 61B as 61A does?
